replies.bodyText: @iakunin it's a stub, we don't know exactly what we need to return for root resource request, when we specify the requirements we'll update this response.
replies.author: g4s8

timeline.bodyText: @g4s8 I cannot figure out the case when split returns array with zero length. Even "".split("/") returns array with one item (empty string).
timeline.author: iakunin

replies.bodyText: @iakunin it's a strange split method behavior, e.g. if you check "/".split("/") it will return empty array, but if you check "".split("/") it will be array with empty string. I added additional condition to handle both cases
replies.author: g4s8

timeline.bodyText: It's a bad idea to use try/catch for flow control
timeline.author: Sammers21

replies.bodyText: @Sammers21 it's not actually, it's a good practice to handle exceptions on the root off application layer, this class is a root in this case, so we need to handle all exceptions here.
